text: - When I started nine years ago,
I started as a cloud support associate.

That's the first time we
hired this role actually.

Before I joined, we did not
have cloud support associate.

And I spent about three
months just learning

with my peer regarding
the cloud technology.
And after nine years here I am.

- I joined AWS as a
cloud support associate
via the premium support graduate program.
Here I was able to apply a lot

of the concepts I learned
during my master's program

while working with real
world customer use cases.
Over the past four years,

I've been able to successfully
progress my career at AWS.
Today I'm an AWS cloud support engineer

working with customers
based around the world.
- I joined AWS as a graduate.

A couple of years later
and I'm now an engineer.

The best part of my job is
that it is really dynamic.
Everything changes very quickly.
Our technologies are constantly evolving

and I'm developing my
skills with this flow
and I'm never bored.

- The Amazon leadership
principle, "learn and be curious",
is one of the key soft skills.
I have always been a people person.

So having the opportunity to
work with amazing colleagues

from different countries
and diverse backgrounds

has definitely improved
my communication skills

and also helped broaden
my outlook on life.

- And of course we have
a lot of opportunities

if people want to pursue
a different career path
and move to different teams in AWS.

- I actually started at AWS
in the support organization.
So I was a cloud support engineer.
And then about two years into that,

I transitioned to being a
partner solutions architect.

Transitioning into the world
was really awesome as well
just because I'd already been working
at AWS for the last two years.
- When I got hired at AWS,
I worked in AWS premium support
and I was a support engineer.
After about a year,
I moved to solutions architecture.
- From here, you can go anywhere.
